title.narrative: MTR-Financial Services for the Poor Strategy

description.narrative: The Financial Services for the Poor Strategy seeks to strengthen the effectiveness of Australia's aid program by providing a coherent framework to guide the Australian Government in achieving its goal of increasing financial services to the poor in developing countries. The objectives of the Mid-term Review are to: assess the performance of the Financial Services for the Poor programs against both the four outcomes in the Strategy, and AusAID's overarching goal of poverty reduction; assess the performance of Financial Services for the Poor programs against Consultative Group to Assist the Poor's SmartAID criteria; and make recommendations on how AusAID might improve its implementation of the Strategy to better achieve its goals by 2015. The total value of this initiative is $0.2 million over 2 years, starting 2011-12.
